metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7182 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ctl_getitem method in ntpd in ntp-4.2.8p6 before 4.2.8p11 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a craftedmode 6 packet with a ntpd instance from 4.2.8p6 through 4.2.8p10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu7.1').
